intro: Nasa picta subsp. picta, commonly known as the picta subsp. picta, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
